summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for August 14, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate movements, staffing, and facility status. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of the prison's administrative functions on a date shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine prison operations including inmate admissions, releases, placements in Special Housing Unit (SHU), and staff leave/ overtime reporting.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This is a routine prison operations report from MCC New York dated August 15, 2019, detailing activities from August 14, 2019.
The report notes the Control Center Fire Panel was inoperative, and several areas were missing required security and inventory reports.
Multiple inmates were admitted to, released from, or placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU), indicating standard inmate movement.
The report details staff leave utilization and overtime hours, showing administrative oversight of personnel.
The document provides no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any unusual incidents, focusing solely on standard correctional facility operations.
